publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1260 Donald Gorrie: Acclaim for National Trust for Scotland Site at Culloden-That the Parliament congratulates the National Trust for Scotland on the high ranking given by American archaeologists to the battlefield of Culloden and urges local authorities, tourist organisations and the owners of famous battlefields, such as Bannockburn, Stirling Bridge, Falkirk, Killiecrankie, Prestonpans and the sites of Montrose's battles, to co-operate in developing these as exciting places for Scots and tourists to visit as part of an overall policy to recognise Scotland's heritage and develop it as a valuable educational and tourist resource.

S2M-1260 Donald Gorrie: Acclaim for National Trust for Scotland Site at Culloden-That the Parliament congratulates the National Trust for Scotland on the high ranking given by American archaeologists to the battlefield of Culloden and urges local authorities, tourist organisations and the owners of famous battlefields, such as Bannockburn, Stirling Bridge, Falkirk, Killiecrankie, Prestonpans and the sites of Montrose's battles, to co-operate in developing these as exciting places for Scots and tourists to visit as part of an overall policy to recognise Scotland's heritage and develop it as a valuable educational and tourist resource. Supported by: Robert Brown*, Carolyn Leckie*, Linda Fabiani*, Nora Radcliffe*, Chris Ballance*, Ms Sandra White*, Murray Tosh*, Robin Harper*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-1260 Acclaim for National Trust for Scotland Site at Culloden (lodged on 4 May 2004) Brian Adam*, Mike Pringle*
S2M-1260 Acclaim for National Trust for Scotland Site at Culloden (lodged on 4 May 2004) Mary Scanlon*, Rhona Brankin*
S2M-1260 Acclaim for National Trust for Scotland Site at Culloden (lodged on 4 May 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-1260 Acclaim for National Trust for Scotland Site at Culloden (lodged on 4 May 2004) Elaine Smith*
